intro: Labisia obtusifolia, commonly known as the broad-leaved labisia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its glossy, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often cultivated as an ornamental plant. Labisia obtusifolia is also valued for its medicinal properties in traditional herbal remedies.
